author: Staff Reporter
text:
Five men were killed and four others were seriously injured in a head-on collision of a car and a mini-van on GNT Road in Arambakkam, near Gummidipoondi in Tiruvallur district, on Sunday evening. Two of the victims were college students from Chennai.

Thiruvallur district police officials said four students from a private college in Sholinganallur had left on Sunday morning for a road trip to Andhra Pradesh in a high-end car. They were travelling on GNT Road-Kolkata Highway (NH 5) when the car rammed a mini-cargo lorry, coming in the opposite direction, took a ‘U’ turn. As it was a blind curve and as the car was travelling at a high speed, it rammed the cargo lorry, the police said.

Three men died on the spot, while the two others died at Rajiv Gandhi Government General Hospital in Chennai.

The police gave the names of the victims as Harish (19) and Yuvaraj (19), students, and Chinnaiah (50), Nagaraj (42) and Nazar (50) of Nellore district in Andhra Pradesh. The four seriously injured persons are being treated in different hospitals.
title: Five killed as car rams cargo vehicle
